abstract.para: The cluster fails over (migrates) resources automatically during software or hardware failures, according to certain parameters you can define (for example, migration threshold or resource stickiness). You can also manually move a resource to another node in the cluster, or move the resource away from the current node and let the cluster decide where to put it.

listitem.para: Away from current node: This creates a location constraint with a -INFINITY score for the current node.
Alternatively, you can move the resource to another node. This creates a location constraint with an INFINITY score for the destination node.

abstract.para: You can move a cluster resource with the &crmshell; (&crmsh;) or with &hawk;.

listitem.para: You can perform this procedure on any node in the cluster.

listitem.para: You can access the &hawk; Web interface from any machine that has network access to the nodes.

step.para: In a Web browser, go to https://HAWKSERVER:7630/ and log in.
From the left navigation bar, select Monitoring Status.
Find the resource you want to move. In the Operations column, click the down arrow button and select Migrate.
From the drop-down list, either keep the default Away from current node or select a specific node to move the resource to.
Click OK to continue.
The node listed in the Location column changes, and a link icon appears in the Status column. Hover the cursor over the link icon to see the name of the new migration constraint.

topic.para: To allow the resource to move back to the original node, you must remove the migration constraint. When you remove the constraint, the resource might move back to the original node automatically or it might stay on the current node, depending on the resource's stickiness.

listitem.para: You can perform this procedure on any node in the cluster.

step.para: Log in either as the &rootuser; user or as a user with sudo privileges.
Show the existing location constraints:
Migration constraints are named either cli-prefer-RESOURCE or cli-ban-RESOURCE-on-NODE.
Remove the migration constraint:
Check the status to see which node the resource is now running on:

listitem.para: You can access the &hawk; Web interface from any machine that has network access to the nodes.

step.para: In a Web browser, go to https://HAWKSERVER:7630/ and log in.
From the left navigation bar, select Monitoring Status.
Find the resource you want to remove the migration constraint from. In the Operations column, click the down arrow button and select Clear.
Click OK to continue.
The link icon disappears from the Status column.
Check the Location column to see which node the resource is now running on.
